intro: Phlegmariurus lignosus, commonly known as the black-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its dark, woody stems and dense clusters of small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces spore-bearing cones, which are typically found at the base of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Phlegmariurus lignosus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
